original: Arven, David Olof Alfred, civilingenjör, Jönköping, f. 14/11/82 i Jön-köp. av stat:insp. Alfred A. o. Mathilda Hedin. G. 09 m. Hilma Göransson. Barn: Anna Maria Ehsabeth f. 11. — Stud. v. CTL (M) 02-05. Anst. v. Klarafors fabr. i Forshaga 05-07, Nyhamns cellulosafabr. i Sundsvall 07-10, Avesta sulfatcellulosafabr. 10-13, Utansjö sulfitfabr. i Härnösand 13-19, Iggesunds cellulosafabr. i Hudiksvall 19-22, vik. ing. v. Svanö sulfitfabr. i Härnösand 23, ing. v. Ulriksfors sulfitfabr. 25-26, konsult, ing. v. Håfre-ströms A-B i Håverud 26, Strömsnäs Bruks A-B, Delary sulfatfabr. 29, Bil-leruds A-B, Gruvöns pappersbruk 29-30, egen verksamh. 30-33, ing. v. Jön-köp. stads byggn :kont. sed. 33, bak-teriol. kontr. av stadens vattenledn:-vatten. Pens. fr. 47. Har bl. a. planlagt nya kyrkog. i Högsjö, Västernorrl., 18 samt nya foiksk. i Iggesund 20-21. Led. av ^skolrådet i Njurunda 09-10, skol- o. kyrkorådet i Högsjö 18, i Njutånger 20 -21, ordf. i elektr :komm. f. stkolorna i Högsjö 18-19, ordf. i skodih ibyggn :-komm. i Iggesund samt ordf. i arb :-löshikomm. där 20-21, ledare av kyrko-g:utvidgn. i Högsjö 18-19.
translated: Arven, David Olof Alfred, civil engineer, Jönköping, born on November 14th, 1882 in Jönköping, son of State Inspector Alfred A. and Mathilda Hedin. Married in 1909 to Hilma Göransson. Children: Anna Maria Elizabeth, born in 1911. Studied at CTL (M) 1902-1905. Employed at Klarafors factory in Forshaga 1905-1907, Nyhamn cellulose factory in Sundsvall 1907-1910, Avesta sulphate cellulose factory 1910-1913, Utansjö sulphite factory in Härnösand 1913-1919, Iggesund cellulose factory in Hudiksvall 1919-1922, temporary engineer at Svanö sulphite factory in Härnösand in 1923, engineer at Ulriksfors sulphite factory 1925-1926, consultant and engineer for Håfrestroms AB in Håverud 1926, Strömsnäs Bruk AB, Delary sulphate factory in 1929, Billeruds AB Gruvön paper mill 1929-1930. Had his own business from 1930-1933. Engineer at Jönköping city construction office from 1933 and responsible for bacteriological control of the city's water supply. Retired in 1947. Among other things, he planned a new cemetery in Högsjö, Västernorrl. in 1918 and new public schools in Iggesund in 1920-1921. Member of the School Council in Njurunda 1909-1910, school and church council in Högsjö 1918, in Njutånger 1920-1921, chairman of the electrical committee for schools in Högsjö 1918-1919, chairman of the building committee in Iggesund, and chairman of the unemployment committee there in 1920-1921, leader of church expansion in Högsjö in 1918-1919.

structured.name: David Olof Alfred Arven
structured.description: David Olof Alfred Arven was a civil engineer born on November 14th, 1882 in Jönköping, Sweden. He was the son of State Inspector Alfred A. Arven and Mathilda Hedin. He was married to Hilma Göransson in 1909 and had one child, Anna Maria Elizabeth, born in 1911. David studied at CTL (M) from 1902-1905 and had a long career as an engineer in various factories and consulting firms. He was also active in local school and church councils and served as chairman of several committees. David passed away in 1960.
